comment.author: 10799299@N00
comment._content: Claudia Carlstedt was an actress who married Albert Gallatin Wheeler Jr., the son of a wealthy capitalist who built the freight tunnels under Chicago query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F40F11F93B5E11... They were divorced in 1912 query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F60B13FC345517... and she then spent many years trying to get him to pay the alimony she had been awarded. Her long and scandalous quest is mentioned several times in the New York Times query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F00A11F63F5C1B... until 1922 when she finally had him arrested and served a court order requiring him to pay up query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=FA0B10F93B5D1A... I can't tell from the newspapers whether she ever wound up getting the money.

comment.author: 10799299@N00
comment._content: Here's a little more info. She returned to the New York stage in 1934, appearing in "Big Hearted Herbert" news.google.com/newspapers?id=eMRBAAAAIBAJ&sjid=0qkMA... She died in 1953 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30A13FA3D59107A... Her obituary mentions her early roles in "The Mandarin" and some Victor Herbert operettas and her famous divorce. At the time of her death she lived in Mattituck, Long Island and was married to Frederick Kistler.

comment._content: j3net:  Thanks!  We'll include her full name with the description next time we update.
